subject: Gardening
title: Climate Change and Garden Ecology
description: A quick win: understand Climate Change and Garden Ecology.

hook.text: Gardening zones are shifting northward. Plants that thrived for decades are failing. New pests are arriving.

buildup.text: Warmer winters mean fewer frost days, longer growing seasons, and new insect species surviving where they never could.

discovery.text: In the UK, the growing season has extended by 29 days since 1990. Mediterranean pests now reach northern Europe.

twist.text: But warmer gardens also support more biodiversity. New pollinator and predator species are arriving alongside new pests.

climax.text: Climate adaptation in gardens means planting for future conditions, not past onesâ€”and welcoming new ecological arrivals.

punchline.text: Garden for the climate you'll have, not the one you had.
